full_text:
CONCEALED WEAPONS – PERMITS – FEE.

	The Chief of Police shall keep a record of all permits authorized by the Board of Police Commissioners under this article. No permit required by Section 55.01 shall be issued to any person until such person shall have paid to the Chief of Police a registration fee of Three ($3.00) Dollars. On Monday of each week the Chief of Police shall pay to the City Treasurer all such registration fees received during the preceding week.

5.catch_line: Assault Weapons – Sale Or Possession Prohibited.

6.catch_line: Use Of Bows And Arrows Prohibited.

8.catch_line: Glass Bottles On Public Property Prohibited.

10.catch_line: Carry Knives Or Daggers In Plain View Prohibited.

12.catch_line: Duty To Report Theft Or Loss Of Firearms; Exemptions.

14.catch_line: Sale Of Ammunition Clips And Similar Devices.

15.catch_line: Sale Or Purchase Of More Than One Handgun Within A Thirty Day Period Prohibited.

18.catch_line: Possession Of Gun Parts In Airports.

19.catch_line: Sale Of Large Caliber Firearms Prohibited.

20.catch_line: Sale Of Ammunition For Large Caliber Firearms Prohibited.

21.catch_line:
False Or Secret Compartments In Vehicles To Hide
Firearms Or Destructive Devices.

plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE

CONCEALED WEAPONS – PERMITS – FEE. (§ 55.03)

  CONCEALED WEAPONS – PERMITS – FEE.	The Chief of Police shall keep a
record of all permits authorized by the Board of Police Commissioners under this
article. No permit required by Section 55.01 shall be issued to any person until
such person shall have paid to the Chief of Police a registration fee of Three
($3.00) Dollars. On Monday of each week the Chief of Police shall pay to the
City Treasurer all such registration fees received during the preceding week.
